name: Skydiver with arms in T-position
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back with your arms extended directly above you at a 90-degree angle to your body, forming a `T` shape with your body.
2. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine and keep it stable throughout the exercise.
3. Take a deep breath in and hold for a moment, focusing on relaxing your shoulders and keeping your arms straight.
4. Exhaling slowly, gently lower your arms down to the sides while keeping them straight, but avoid pressing your shoulders down or scrunching your body upwards.
5. Hold this position for 2-3 seconds, breathe naturally and maintain control through your entire spine and core muscles.
6. Slowly raise your arms back up above you, returning to the original starting position.
7. Repeat as needed.
short_summary: The skydiver with arms in T-position is an exercise targeting stability, posture, and scapular engagement across upper body muscles.
